revised_title: Shear Stress and Dispersive Pressure in Gravity-Free Grain Fluids
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the dispersion of large solid spheres in a Newtonian fluid under shear, finding that a substantial radial dispersive pressure is exerted between the grains. This pressure was measured as an increase in static pressure and was found to bear a single-valued empirical relation to a dimensionless shear strain group. The results have implications for understanding natural phenomena and hydraulic problems.
